name: Dinosaur Bar-B-Que
address: 700 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA

reviews.text: It is so sad that those burgers are good because the place in Syracuse was small and they gave us a table in the back and it was close to the wall full of flies. We were disgusted with so many flies all over us that we have no intentions of going back. They should do something about it or the customers will fly away too. We went from NJ, not worth it.
Es war das beste BBQ, dass wir in unseren 3,5 Wochen NY hatten. Absolute Empfehlung! :)

This is my go-to place when Iâ€™m craving BBQ ribs! Theyâ€™re so yummy and delicious. The atmosphere is great, the service is friendly, and the prices are reasonable. Itâ€™s a perfect spot to go with kids and enjoy a good meal. Highly recommend!!

I went here with my boyfriend and the waitress looked like she didnâ€™t even work there she had a face full of makeup and she just kept coming over every minute literally we couldnâ€™t even hold a conversation with each other.  Felt like she was flirting to be honest so unprofessional. If we needed something we wouldâ€™ve just asked. Donâ€™t be so persistent and desperate cause we tip big over here you donâ€™t gotta do all that smh
ì¡´ë§›íƒ± ì–‘ ë§ìŒ í•µì¶”ì²œ.
Food is always great. Staff is very attentive and nice. Isaac was an excellent waiter the staff from the manager and food runners very friendly and provided excellent service.
I ordered from uber eats, the meat was amazing, I just did not like the mac and cheese but I will not cut a point because I believe that you will make it better in the future.

There staff was amazing.   They were extremely attentive and accommodating. They continously checked on us to ensure our meals and drinks were to our standards.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere was friendly.
Had a great time sitting and chatting with family. We both enjoyed the food and service given by staff. This is the place to go with friends and family.
I love the catfish

Great barbecue. Good drinks. Fun atmosphere. 4 stars.

UPDATE:
Several years ago I left the review above. However, I returned years later for lunch. Unfortunately, certain food items on the menu has not maintained its desirability or adequate serving size.

What stood out the most was the collard greens. The flavor is good and a little spicy (which I like); however, since the serving is finely  chopped, you're mostly eating the stems and not the collard greens. I'm sure it's 50/50, but whatever the ratio, it is not appetizing or justified when ordering collard greens.

The next food item is their pork belly. This "appetizer-sized" portion of a semi-thick slab of "bacon" cut in three pieces should not be served as an entree item with combo plates. This is not how pork belly is traditionally served and due to its thinly cut portion it tends to be over cooked. If anything, it would be best served only as a slider with pulled-pork.

Avoid this item, as the portion size does not justify the cost of a $26.50 two-item combo plate. As a recommendation to the restaurant, please describe on the menu how this pork belly is prepared and served as a thin slab.

In conclusion, I spoke with two managers to convey my dissatisfaction. They kindly offered another "slab" of pork belly, which I declined. So, instead, they generously discounted my check by $3.90 (15%) of my order.

Thanks, Dinasaur Bar-B-Que!
Did not eat here but I scrolled through the photos and did not see any dinosaurs whatsoever.

Dinosaur Bar-B-Que â€“ Harlem, NY

If youâ€™re craving real, smoky, fall-off-the-bone BBQ in New York, this spot hits the mark! The brisket was unbelievably tender â€” juicy, perfectly smoked, and drenched in their tangy house sauce. Every bite melts in your mouth with that deep, slow-cooked flavor you can only get from real pit barbecue.

The whipped sweet potatoes were a surprise standout â€” buttery, creamy, and just the right touch of orange flavor sweetness to balance the smoky meats.
Service was impressively quick and friendly, even though the place was packed. Food came out hot and fresh in no time, which made the whole experience even better.

The vibe is classic Harlem â€” rustic wood, buzzing energy, and that smoky aroma drifting from the open kitchen. A great spot for hearty comfort food with zero pretense.

The food was absolutely phenomenal. The trio platter, which included two sides, was a perfect choice. The 1/4 chicken, pulled chicken, and brisket were all incredibly delicious. The spicy cucumber salad was also a standout dish. The service was excellent, and the staff was accommodating and attentive, even with our large group.
I wasnâ€™t able to order.  The place was overcrowded.  The wait time was 30 minutes.  Iâ€™ve been there in the past year. At the beginning the food was great but the quality is coming downhill.
The sweetheart deal is my favorite..... I eat some there and take some to go....

2/21/25 â€“ 7 PM

Went here with my boyfriend at 7 PM and boy, it was packed! The place was bustling and since we didnâ€™t have a reservation, we ended up waiting about 45 minutes for a table. Note to self (and to anyone else thinking of going): make a reservation. Even people with reservations still had to wait a bit, so that says a lot about how busy it gets.

Once we finally sat down, it took about 30 minutes for our food to come out. We started with chicken wings (3 pc for $6.50 or 6 pc for 12.50) â€” I had the honey BBQ and he had the jerk glaze. For mains, my boyfriend ordered the jerk salmon with mac and cheese and Syracuse-style potatoes ($23.50). I went for the combo plateâ€”Â¼ chicken and prime brisketâ€”with whipped sweet potatoes and French fries ($26). We also had their strawberry lemonade, which was super sweet but really refreshing.

Overall, the food was worth the wait. Everything was flavorful and satisfying, and Iâ€™d definitely come backâ€”but this time with a reservation, lol.

The service was exceptional that  the server provided. She was patient, helpful, friendly & recommend what was economical on the menu for a party of four. Everything we order was delicious & filling. The restaurant has a nice ambiance & location which is near the Hudson River. Highly recommend when in Harlem. Also It was good to be home again & see all the new changes in Harlem after 40 yrs.

I havenâ€™t been here in 5 years and decided to come because I remember it being good but I wouldnâ€™t recommend visiting after this time. We had brisket with two sides and the fried chicken bowl. We waited 35 min for the food so we expected it to at least be hot and both plates were cold. The brisket was gray and fatty, and the sides werenâ€™t even the one I ordered. The chicken bowl was swimming in water from the greens. It was honestly nasty. I was shocked. The only redeeming part of dinner was the drink (because it was strong) and the corn bread, which was tasty. I know that the team is working hard but you guys have to do better.

We had the BEST experience here for a family birthday. Food and service was amazing and they brought out complementary dessert and sang happy birthday very welcoming staff and we will be back for future birthdays
Great BBQ, hip with an Uptown vibe!
Wow and wow. The food is exquisite, this company made the catering for my job. I was totally in shock, every single thing was just in other level of flavorâ€¦I love it!

Dinosaur Bar-B-Que in Harlem (right off 125th Street by the Hudson River) is a fantastic spot for classic southern barbecue in a great location. The restaurant is super clean, with a lively yet comfortable atmosphere, and the staff are always friendly and welcoming.

The space is versatile â€” you can grab a seat at the bar, sit at tall tables, or settle in at regular tables. It works equally well for big groups, small gatherings, or even solo meals.

As for the food, itâ€™s exactly what youâ€™d hope for: smoky brisket, tender baby back ribs, pulled pork, and all the classic southern sides like coleslaw, potatoes, and fries. Portions are generous, flavors are bold, and everything is served hot and fresh.

The location is a real plus too â€” right next to a park by the river, making it perfect to stroll before or after your meal.

If youâ€™re looking for authentic BBQ in NYC with great service and a prime setting, this place is hard to beat.
The greatest happy hour in NYC

Dinosaur Bar-B-Que
700 W. 125th. St.
New York, NY 10027

Wango Habanero Wings
1/4 Rack Ribs
Cajun Fried Catfish

This is with no exaggeration one of the best barbecue establishments I ever explored.

Wango Habanero Wings:
This is the perfect combination of sweet and spice.

1/4 Rack Ribs:
The tender wings fell right off the bone.  The sauce was so amazing I wish I could have drank the sauce by the bottle!

Cajun Fried Catfish:
Even the non-barbecue items are a hit!  The catfish was covered with crispy cornmeal and my favorite topping is the black-eyed pea relish.

Aside from unbelievably fast service, my server was was friendly and he even recognized me from previous visits.

My only regret is that I wish I had ordered larger portions, but there will always be a next time.

#dinosaurbarbecue #harlemny #rackifribs #dinosaurbarbecueharlem #wangohabanerowings #cajunfriedcatfish #nycfoodie
Chilled atmosphere.     Everything was well made.   Mac n ğŸ§€ cheese need more cheesy flavor.   Ribs were fall of the bone.   Delish.

ausgezeichnet Essen

War ein tolles Erlebnis dort zu Essen. Mega BBQ , wir hatten Brisket, Ribs, Sausage, Mc&cheese, Coleslaw.
Vielen lieben Dank an die Pit Crew Marc und  den KÃ¼chenchefJermone, die uns die KÃ¼che und die Smoker gezeigt haben. Man merkt das sie lieben was sie machen und das Ergebnis eines perfektem BBQ bekommt der Gast auf den Teller. Tolles Team im Service. Das beste BBQ welches wir in NY bekommen haben.

Wonderful
Visited after watching the baseball at the Yankees
Had a cracking meal..
The ribs were to die for
My wife had a burger and loved it.
Food and drinks came to $58 the cheapest meal we had during our stay in NYC
Cross over the road to The Baylander after for dinks on the river ..
Highly recommended

Been to this place more than a few times I usually love the ribs, but they felt tougher than normal. I also got the brisket which was very good. The spicy cucumber salad was very spicy; great for me but not everyone at the table. Wings are also a family favorite here

The restaurant was very well lit and all the expectations one would expect for a BBQ restaurant. I honestly did not try an entree but I did try the nachos. The nachos were a bit of a disappointment but I still enjoyed them. It was not giving what expected. Not enough chicken and way toooo much cheese  and sauces.
What a vibe. Amazing food, great beer. Will be back again and again and again. The sausage was AMAZING
Flavorful and smoky meat! Got the tres nino sampler plate and was shocked at the amount of meat. My favorite has to be the ribs.
Delicious food and huge portions.  What more can I say?
Location ideale per un ottimo pasto americano. Carne strepitosa, contorni e dolci ottimi.
Been coming here for years. Always a good time.
I didn't stay to eat this day... because it was an extremely long wait. But, it is my go-to BBQ spot! ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¾â€¦
Delicious ğŸ˜‹
Never disappointed

The food never disappoints whenever I come here. I usually get the combo plate and they give you a lot of food for a good deal! The drinks are incredibly strong and great. Sometimes they donâ€™t serve everything on the drink menu so just ask. The location is also great by the water for a post food walk!
Delicious food,they have the best lemonade.
I just love the food and the drinks
Very good place for dinner and drinks

The Dinosaur Bar-B-Que restaurant is an absolute amazing barbecue based chain that offers guest delicious Southern style cuisine ranging from brisket, ribs, pulled pork and wings.

In February of 2019, I brought and treated my wife and myself for dinner at Dinosaur Bar-B-Que, specifically the branch based in Harlem, New York to celebrate our Happy One Year Wedding Anniversary!!! We both very much enjoyed our dining experience!!!

The staff warmly greeted us when we arrived at the restaurant and quickly provided us with a very large and comfortable dining table. Our server, Joel was very kind, superbly professional and made us feel right at home. He did a great job on explaining the menu options, the specials for the day and offered great tips on the dishes that we were likely to favor and enjoy. In addition, he perfectly noted our orders, and routinely checked in on us to make sure we were having a good time and that our needs were met. We thank Joel for his hospitality and wonderful service.

Ultimately my wife and I decided to order the â€œFamily Stylin Bar-B-Queâ€ entree which consists of 6 pieces of whole chicken, full rack of ribs, an order of pork or brisket, cornbread and 3 homemade sides. We were both in awe of the sheer quantity of food that was provided and we found every dish to be well cooked, perfectly seasoned and fabulously delicious. Everything was flawlessly made and a delight to eat!!!

If you enjoy Southern style cuisine coupled with great hospitality, youâ€™ll definitely enjoy visiting and dining at Dinosaur Bar-B-Que. My wife and I would love to thank this great restaurant for providing us an exceptional dining experience, one that weâ€™ll cherish forever!!!

The visit to Dinosaur Bar-B-Que was disappointing. While anticipating Southern-style barbecue, the reality did not meet expectations. The ribs, though tender, were dry and needed a lot of sauce to be enjoyable. The brisket also lacked flavor and was dry. The macaroni and cheese was bland and dry, not the creamy dish expected.
The dining experience was made worse by the service. The server was attentive at first but became unavailable after delivering the food, making it difficult to get drink refills or additional napkins.
Considering the inconsistencies in food quality, issues and disappointing service, a return to Dinosaur Bar-B-Que is unlikely.

Today was our firstâ€”and definitely lastâ€”visit to Dinosaur Bar-B-Que. We were excited to try their menu and ordered the half family-style BBQ to sample a variety of items. Unfortunately, the experience was very disappointing.

The pork ribs, which we were most looking forward to, were overcooked, dry, and drowned in sauce. Instead of enhancing the flavor, the excessive sauce just made things worse. The overall quality didnâ€™t live up to the hype or the prices.

I donâ€™t recommend this restaurant. There are much better BBQ spots out there.
I get delivery. Food is great, prices are reasonable, portions are good, website is easy to use.
Ribsss ğŸ¤¤

I can sum it up in one word and that would be â€œawful,â€ unfortunately
Here we go for $120 bill for two people:
- Nachos was great. Tasty. Well prepared. I would recommend that.
- pork belly: it was micro-portion. It was three very very very tiny pieces. Covered in chives. Gets 2/10 for taste.
- St. Luis ribs: very thin and dry. It was cold as dead animal on my plate. So cold that I couldnâ€™t eat.
- Prime Brisket: I donâ€™t know if they understand the meaning of prime. It was a lump of brisket. Cold with solidified fat on it. This was rather an insult.
- BBQ sauces were anything but BBQ sauce
- drinks were standard
- service was above all

It was a $30-50 meal served for $120

Visiting from out of town was nice and it was a nice atmosphere, good vibes and was able to accommodate a party of 15. There were a lot of provocative wall art for young children to see, that would be my only complaint of the atmosphere.

Our waitress was a little slow at first getting to us but altogether she was good. She was knowledgeable of the menu and tried to accommodate us as best she could. Some of the drinks and food items we asked for were not available which was a little disappointing but overall the food and drinks that we were able to get were good.

My husband had the beef ribs, Mac and cheese and creole potato salad. He says the ribs and Mac and cheese were AMAZING but there was nothing Creole about the potato salad, it was just regular potato salad, so he feels like he couldâ€™ve picked something better.

I had the make your own salad with jerk salmon. The salad was a pretty big serving, however there was no jerk on the salmon and the portion of salmon was small for the amount of salad. And I needed to ask for more dressing. The DEVILD EGGS were soooo delicious.

Everything was delicious especially The Korean style short ribs and Mac & Cheese, Personally I loved the potato salad so much but kids are not big fan because of the gherkins inside! Our waitress was very helpful ( went through the trouble to get me some hot water) and knowledgeable about the food! We went on a Sunday 3pm ish so not that busy got served straight away! I would definitely recommend everyone to try this place!

The food wasnâ€™t as seasoned as I expected. The Mac and cheese was very bland. The bbq was dry rub with not much flavor. The steak was ok but the chimichurri was actually very good. The cornbread tasted like it came from a box and was not edible. The nachos came very late so we didnâ€™t get to enjoy it. The veggies were overcooked. The dessert was very good though, the cookie was very soft and very chocolaty. I also took off a star because the toilet is facing the crack in the door. Someone standing waiting to use it, can see you sitting on the toilet. The bathroom was also very dirty. The staff were amazing though and very friendly. I give them 5 stars !
One of the best places for real smoked food. The vegetarian style collards are delicious. The Mac and cheese was spot on and the fried green tomatoes definitely are a must.

ribs are great! I got the tree chicos ($20) and the ribs were the best. great seasoning and flavour, meat was tender. the brisket was quite salty and the pulled pork was tasty but the texture was unusual, felt a bit like tuna. id recommend getting just the ribs .  the side dishes were nice- I had the spicy cucumber and the fried rice.

I recently dined at your restaurant and wanted to share some detailed feedback â€” because the potential here is huge.

Areas for Improvement:
â€¢	Coleslaw â€“ Unfortunately, this felt like a low-effort side. The flavor profile was very flat, almost as if it were just mayo and a touch of black pepper. A bit of acidity, crunch variety, or seasoning could make this pop.
â€¢	Potato Salad â€“ Bland overall; it didnâ€™t stand out in any way. A little more seasoning or texture variation could go a long way.
â€¢	Sweet Potatoes â€“ I appreciated the citrus note, but it didnâ€™t quite come together. The nuts that accompanied them lacked depth of flavor and didnâ€™t enhance the dish the way they could have.
â€¢	Mac and Cheese â€“ This was the biggest disappointment. It lacked the rich, indulgent flavor and creaminess I was expecting. This dish could be a showstopper with a more robust cheese blend or seasoning.

What Worked Well:
â€¢	Brisket â€“ Outstanding. Iâ€™d recommend this without hesitation.
â€¢	Wings â€“ Bursting with flavor; really enjoyable.
â€¢	Pork Belly â€“ Decent flavor, but Iâ€™d love to see this transformed into something more exciting, like a sandwich or slider. I probably wouldnâ€™t order it again as is.

Other Notes:
Thereâ€™s a wide range of drink options, but our server didnâ€™t highlight or recommend any, it felt rushed, which felt like a missed opportunity. A quick rundown of popular or unique drinks could really elevate the dining experience.

Overall, youâ€™ve got some great proteins and a solid foundation. With more attention to seasoning, balance, and presentation for the sides - plus a little more proactive service - this could easily be one of my go-to spots.

Over the past couple of months, Iâ€™ve been on the hunt to satisfy my craving for perfectly fried catfishâ€”little did I know, it was right here on the menu at Dinosaur BBQ all along! While my usual favorites are the fried green tomatoes, Brisket sliders and the BBQ Rib Sweetheart Deal (which never disappoints), I decided to switch things up, and Iâ€™m so glad I did.

The catfish dinner was nothing short of fantastic. The fish was fried to a flawless golden crisp, boasting a well-seasoned crust that delivered just the right amount of crunch with every bite. The accompanying sides complemented the dish perfectly, rounding out a truly satisfying Southern-style meal. If youâ€™re a fan of authentic, well-executed fried catfish, I highly recommend giving this dish a try!

I went some time ago, so this review is long overdue. The decor is super country style/rugged- very cool. The food is delicious. You canâ€™t go wrong with anything you order. If youâ€™re in the area and want good barbecue, I highly recommend it.

BEER: My draft beer was poured with no head: at a 45Â° angle, with the nozzle IN the beer.

I noted this, and stirred it a bit, and then it SPILLED EVERYWHERE.

The proper pour is about half at 45Â°, and then the rest at 90Â° and you want a head on it. My experience is the result of improper staff training or just pure laziness.

If you properly release the carbonation on a beer, it will have a proper head. The head delivers the aroma and flavor. Also, with the carbonation properly released, customers are less likely to feel bloated, and are more likely to order more drinks.

At least it was cold.

The same way it spilled all over the place, is the same way it makes people feel bloated when drinking beer without a release of the CO2.

FOOD: The pulled pork was dry. The brisket and St. Louis Style ribs were well seasoned.

The meat had sauce on it (which I didnâ€™t ask for). The sauce was terrible and tastes like pure tomato and sugar. I had to wipe it off of everything. Iâ€™d rather be asked if I want sauce on my food, considering itâ€™s also at the table. The beans were overly sweet.

The food is very salty. There is no flavor or any seasoning. Everything is either overcooked and undercooked. The mac & cheese has absolutely no flavor. The chicken tastes old, the french fries are burnt with no flavor. This is honestly the worst food Iâ€™ve eaten in a long time and we ordered a lot of food for a large family. I definitely wonâ€™t be coming back here.

Super lecker. GroÃŸe Portionen, haben ihren Preis, aber die QualitÃ¤t ist super und dann bezahle ich das gerne.
Personal sehr freundlich und eine sehr lockere AtmosphÃ¤re.
SchÃ¶nes, typisches Amerikanisches Ambiente, wie man es sich vorstellt.

WOW AND WOW.   It all began with the host who greeted us so warmly.  Then our server Dixie(sorry if i misspelled)  WOW. She truly was AMAZING.  The food and drinks are 100% WOW.  I had the BEST CHICKEN SANDWICH AND WHIPPED SWEET POTATOES....im going back with a very large party. Im telling everyone about this gem.  WOW.  I was truly amazed at how much love they put into the food. We ordered other stuff and everything was amazing. This is a must go to place. I will also be ordering delivery food from here. Sorry not many pictures because i was too busy eating such amazing food

Restaurant was a whole vibe. The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was great. You have to try the Dirty South Bowl at the Harlem location. Iâ€™m from the south so it was nice to try their take on southern food!
Amazing good and a great atmosphere. I love the decor they have. Would highly recommend the ribs, cornbread, creole potato salad, and fries.

This is a great spot to visit with a group of friends. The space is large and has outdoor seating, making it a really nice spot for a casual meet-up. Just a heads-up: if you are coming on a weekend night, the place gets packed, and you will have to wait for a seat.

Before I go any further, if you are from a well-known BBQ city, you may be disappointed. I'm not saying the food is not good--just setting the expectation.

On my last visit, I came with friends for a birthday dinner. We ordered the Family Stylin' BBQ. For mains, we had pulled pork, a rack of ribs, and asked to have brisket instead of the chicken. For sides, we had mac and cheese, Syracuse-style salt potatoes, and BBQ fried rice.

The rack of ribs was a hit. They had good seasoning and a noticeable smoke ring. The pulled pork was also good; it was juicy and tender. However, the brisket was not good. Right off the bat, I was turned off by the sauce that was smothered on top. The sauce was too overpowering and tangy, working overtime to mask how dry and chewy the brisket was. I encourage you to skip the brisket. The mac and cheese were very run-of-the-mill, but the potatoes were good

Visited Dino's with some co-workers after work they said, "I had to try the Brisket," so i said cool im down." We arrived wa seated quickly. The order taker was very polite and efficient .food came out pretty fast . ( had a Virgin pina coloda, it was delicious) i ordered double Brisket, the pulled chicken with sweet mash, and mac & cheese on the side . The Brisket was good, but i definitely had better wasn't what it was hyped up to be, but still good the sweet mash was good as well as the Mac. The pulled chicken was a lil salty but ok not .(yea just ok)  all in all it was a good time .

Good experience overall.
Food was as expected. Memphis style sandwich with sweet potatoes good. The deviled eggs were not good.
Service was fine
Atmosphere was fun and lively.
The corn bread was excellent but the ribs were just ok. I have had better like blue smoke

So prior to my first review, the management reached out for me to come back and retry their food. When I tell you that this time, to come and dine in was a completely different experience. IT WAS AMAZINGGGGGG. From the staff, the manager Samatha , to the food and accompanying my mom due to her disability. EVERYONE LOVED IT. NOW THIS IS THE DINOSAURS I REMEMBER. We will be back . My favorite is the briskets and chicken. The deviled eggs was better this time and you can tell they took their time with the food as well. KUDOS to the whole restaurant, they did their big one on this . Mark my words : I WILL BE BACK LOL

Love this spot! My family and I have been coming here for years!
Itâ€™s always a hit, never fails! The ribs, wings, chicken! Everything is sooo delicious!
Donkey punch is our favorite drink, my mom loves it. There is live music some nights, I done karaoke once too a few years ago. Iâ€™m in North Carolina now but whenever I go to NYC , I have to visit Dinosaurs :)
The servers are always so friendly and kind!
Delicious food, hefty portions, and great vibe. Service was kinda slow and he forgot some things we ordered, but besides that a great experience overall.

I enjoyed the vibe an atmosphere of this place so much Iâ€™m gonna make this a weekly thing. ğŸ•ºğŸ¾
My waitress Johnee was AMAZING!!! She gave honest recommendations and was also super helping with letting us sample sides we wasnâ€™t to sure about ordering.
The last time Iâ€™ve had Fried Green Tomatoes that good was in Louisiana I highly recommend ordering them.
DONT ORDER THE JERK SALMON!!!  Everything else is good tho the drinks the baked beans the Mac & Cheese. Looking forward to exploring more of the menu in my future visits.

I don't like their BBQ sauce. I had the ribs very  tender .my waiter was very nice. There were 2 ladies sitting behind me, and their waiter continuously kept coming over to them asking" is everything ok" . They keep saying everything is fine. I wanted to tell her go somewhere until they call you. So happy my waiter wasn't that persistent
